abstract.original_text: When statistical analyses are reported, confirm that the following items are present in the relevant location (e.g. figure legend, table legend, main text, or Methods section).

sentences.segment_text: confirm that the following items are present in the relevant location ( e.g. figure legend , table legend , main text , or Methods section ) .

abstract.original_text: The exact sample size (n) for each experimental group/condition, given as a discrete number and unit of measurement An indication of whether measurements were taken from distinct samples or whether the same sample was measured repeatedly

sentences.segment_text: The exact sample size ( n ) for each experimental group/condition ,
given as a discrete number and unit of measurement An indication of whether measurements were taken from distinct samples or whether the same sample was measured repeatedly

abstract.original_text: The statistical test(s) used AND whether they are one-or two-sided Only common tests should be described solely by name; describe more complex techniques in the Methods section.

sentences.segment_text: The statistical test ( s ) used AND whether they are one-or two-sided Only common tests should be described solely by name ; describe more complex techniques in the Methods section .

abstract.original_text: A description of all covariates tested A description of any assumptions or corrections, such as tests of normality and adjustment for multiple comparisons A full description of the statistics including central tendency (e.g. means) or other basic estimates (e.g. regression coefficient) AND variation (e.g. standard deviation) or associated estimates of uncertainty (e.g. confidence intervals)

sentences.segment_text: A description of all covariates tested A description of any assumptions or corrections ,

such as tests of normality and adjustment for multiple comparisons A full description of the statistics including central tendency ( e.g. means ) or other basic estimates ( e.g. regression coefficient ) AND variation ( e.g. standard deviation ) or associated estimates of uncertainty ( e.g. confidence intervals )

abstract.original_text: For null hypothesis testing, the test statistic (e.g. F, t, r) with confidence intervals, effect sizes, degrees of freedom and P value noted Give P values as exact values whenever suitable. For Bayesian analysis, information on the choice of priors and Markov chain Monte Carlo settings For hierarchical and complex designs, identification of the appropriate level for tests and full reporting of outcomes Estimates of effect sizes (e.g. Cohen's d, Pearson's r), indicating how they were calculated Clearly defined error bars State explicitly what error bars represent (e.g. SD, SE, CI)

sentences.segment_text: For null hypothesis testing , the test statistic ( e.g. F , t , r ) with confidence intervals ,
effect sizes , degrees of freedom and P value noted Give P values as exact values whenever suitable .
For Bayesian analysis , information on the choice of priors and Markov chain Monte Carlo settings For hierarchical and complex designs ,
identification of the appropriate level for tests and full reporting of outcomes Estimates of effect sizes ( e.g. Cohen 's d , Pearson 's r ) ,
indicating how they were calculated Clearly defined error bars State explicitly what error bars represent ( e.g. SD , SE , CI )
